Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Bilateral Superficial Cervical Plexus Block in Thyroid and Parathyroid Surgery

Intervention.evidence: BSCPB significantly reduced postoperative pain compared to control

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the efficacy of bilateral superficial cervical plexus block (BSCPB) with and without adjuncts in reducing postoperative pain.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the reduction in postoperative pain, measured by Visual Analog Scale scores at 6–24 hours post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 1507 patients were included, with 753 in the BSCPB group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The pooled analysis showed that BSCPB significantly reduced postoperative pain compared to control (pooled risk ratio = 0.390, 95% CI: 0.303–0.501, p<0.05).
